Cedar Park, TX 6/21/2012 2 Check-ins Here I love the moonies burger. Some people describe it as greasy. But there are two things you need to consider. 1) Its a hamburger, fat = taste. 2) They use hawaiian bread which is inherently sweet.
Anyways, the mushroom swiss is the winner for me. With nice crispy fries. mmmm
All the burgers are good, and then at the Anderson Mill/Research location you have the option of blue bell milk shakes. Don't go here looking for healthy meals, although the chicken sandwiches always looked good. I am confident it is my favorite in the area.

Georgetown, TX 6/22/2012 I decided to give *this* Moonie's location a chance, since I've written off the Cedar Park and Pflugerville locations. See my older reviews.
That turned out to be a complete waste of time, unfortunately.
I wanted to be proven wrong... I wanted to be impressed... I wanted to like it.
I wasn't wrong... I wasn't impressed... I didn't like it.
The place is a mess. It's dirty. It's dumpy. The food took FOREVER and it was 'average' flavor. Nothing spectacular, and not worth $12 for a burger, drink and rings.
Sorry, Moonie's, that's three strikes for you... you're out.

Austin, TX 4/9/2012 Their burgers and fries (crispy and sweet potato!) are quite good.
It's in my neighborhood and I have been here many times, eat in and carry out.
Their service is bad or perfectly satisfactory depending upon luck, I suppose. I've come many times and have been satisfied with the service. Other times I've had our order lost on a very slow day and waited forever, without even an apology from the waiter. At my request they did get my young child some fries to eat while we waited. It did seem they weren't real thrilled to do so, though. I've also been told to stand in a line 15+ customers long to pay for my to-go order?! Why even bother with calling in the order if I have to wait to pay while my food gets cold. They have no sings for a to-go line either, which would be useful since the line can be long at times.
I'm usually rather patient and understanding, and at times their service bothers even me.
I continue to return from time to time as the food is definitely good, and it's location is convenient for me. I will say we'd likely come more often if the service was better and the prices a little cheaper.
Certainly worth checking out for the burger and fries.

We have all ordered a variety of their burgers and have all enjoyed our burger and fries very much. The milkshakes are very thick and tasty, as well. Austin, TX 5/10/2011 Just tried out Moonie's today and I really liked it!
I got to say, it's not a gourmet burger palace like Hop Doddy's and they won't serve your burger to temperature but that being said, it's a great restaurant if you're in the market for a tasty burger, good crispy fries, and a filling experience.
It's a burger house so you have to assume that the presence of many loud and screaming children is likely...unfortunately. But you're not exactly here for the ambiance either.
It's a nice thick meat patty that's cooked through and through. I had the California burger and my boyfriend had the Swiss Mushroom burger. Both had good flavor and the patties were juicy so we weren't lacking in that department. Excellent bun! It's slightly sweet, firm to the touch, but it has a very surprisingly fluffy texture when you chew on it. It's strange but for as many toppings as mine had, it was constructed fairly well. SO well that it didn't disintegrate in my hands like most burgers will.
The FRIES! The fries were great. Both crispy and sweet potato fries were very crisp and hot out of the fryer. Definite bonus points there!
Thumps up!

Austin, TX 6/9/2011 I was hungggerrryyy on Sunday at almost 8:15 PM. Where to go? Too late for most spots. Too lazy to cook. Oh what's a food fanatic to do? RING RING "Moonie's, how may I help you?" Me - "What time do you close?" "9" "BE RIGHT THERE" It was almost closing time. The restaurant was pretty empty. Staff was cleaning up. They saw us coming. Stopped cleaning, put on a big genuine smile, and asked "What can we get for you tonight?" GREAT SERVICE already. Loving it already.
My sister got the Hawaiian Chicken Sandwich, the lady got a California Burger without the cheese ( saddened me ), and I got the Chile Cheese Burger with Frito's on top. And for sides, we got the Sweet Potato Fries and some onion rings.
To start, the portions are filling. I struggled (willingly) to finish the meal. The bread tasted slightly sweet and fresh. The Hawaiian wasn't my favorite because I've had one that was so much better. It wasn't bad but my bias just puts me in a position to judge. The California was excellent. The smooth texture of the avocado mixing with the crisp bacon was a mouthwatering combination. Not to tote the whistle of the person who suggested I get the chili cheese burger, but good lawd that was tasty. The chili didn't run too much or make the buns soggy. The Fritos on top added an awesome crunch. The cheese held everything together. The onion rings were extra crunchy, even after getting nuked in the microwave. The sweet potato fries needed a slight dusting of salt.
Sadly the menu isn't that large BUT it makes it easier for me to go back and try EVERYTHING. Don't judge me.

Austin, TX 12/31/2010 I went to Moonie's for lunch with a few friends today - I ordered the veggie burger and turned it into a combo meal.
The price is really reasonable ($4.99) - I appreciate that they don't charge you more for a veggie burger than a beef burger. The veggie patty was okay - some sort of mixture of a Gardenburger and a black bean patty. Bun was delicious, veggies were fresh.

The fries were good - hot, crispy on the outside. I think they are standard boxed fries though as I've had really similar stuff before.
Service was a little bit of a miss - my two friends ordered right before me and probably had their food for a solid ten minutes before I got mine. Sometimes veggie patties take longer to cook (usually b/c they are frozen), but it would have been nice of the cashier to mention this so I knew to expect a wait.
Overall, a pretty decent place to hit up for lunch - the menu looks interesting so maybe I will try a different sandwich and they have Blue Bell ice cream shakes which are always a winner.

Austin, TX 3/10/2010 With a name like "Moonie's", I was expecting this place to be more of a '50s diner than a country-bumpkin road house, if it had any shtick at all. I almost felt like I was in the back woods of Arkansas. I think "Boonie's" is a better name for this place. When I walked in and heard annoyingly twangy country music, I nearly walked right out, but I figured since I'd wasted the gas getting over there, I might as well stay and eat.
So I ventured to the counter and ordered a Plain Jane with cheddar, and some onion rings. Grabbed my number and filled my drink. I'd heard they had Coke Zero on tap here, but I was disappointed when I spied an "out of order" sign on it. So I got iced tea, which was made very well. But how can you really mess up iced tea?
My burger and onion rings were brought out quickly. It looked good, and I couldn't wait to dig in. The first several bites were nothing but bun, as my burger had a huge pillow of a bun that tasted like a dinner roll. It was too much, so I removed the bottom bun. And once I did so, I realized just how small the burger was that I'd paid about $7 for (my entire bill was over $11 for a burger, rings, and a fountain drink). I can get a much bigger mediocre burger and rings at the Lakeline Fuddrucker's location for the same price.
The meat itself was overcooked, and I didn't like the spices they used. I discovered fennel seeds on the burger, which pissed me off. Some people like licorice, but not me. The cheese, lettuce and mayo made the burger almost bearable. Almost. I got slightly more than halfway through the burger, but it was too mediocre for me to finish.
The rings weren't too bad, so I concentrated on those.
Thankfully, the powers that be randomly shut off the twang-fest country music that was playing, so I didn't feel compelled to leave quite as quickly as I originally had.
I expected a lot more from Boonie's. My mistake, I guess. And so, my search for Austin's best burger continues.
